newsitem.title: SPAIN: Demand for Spain's Telefonica share offer intense.
newsitem.headline: Demand for Spain's Telefonica share offer intense.

text.p: The institutional tranche of Spanish telecoms firm Telefonica's share offer was 4.63 times oversubscribed while the retail tranche was nine times oversubscribed, a source close to the deal said on Saturday.

The government was selling its remaining 20.9 percent stake in Telefonica in the offer which is set to price on Monday and begin being traded on Tuesday. Friday was the last day to order shares in Spain's largest placement ever.
The source said 317 million share orders were received for the entire institutional tranche of 68 million shares.
The Spanish institutional tranche of 13 million shares received orders for 91 million shares, 6.6 times the offer.
An international institutional tranche of 54 million shares was 4.12 times oversubscribed with 225 million shares ordered.
Demand for a retail tranche offered only to Spanish investors was the highest.
For 78 million shares offered, 738 million were ordered.
The source said the government could increase shares offered in the Spanish retail tranche on Monday due to the strong domestic appetite.
A Telefonica spokesman said on Friday the definitive breakdown of the shares to the various tranches will be made public on Monday.
At the current price of 3,350 pesetas ($23.46) a share, the public purse would gain revenues of 600 billion pesetas from the sale if all 191.5 million shares are allocated.
